refnamediv.refpurpose: Buffer for storage of video frames

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ArvBuffer provides a class for the instantiation of buffers used for the storage of the separate images of the video stream. The actual data space may either be allocated by ArvBuffer during an object instatiation, of preallocated. ArvBuffer also allows the transmission of image metadata, such as offsets and size of the transmitted region of interrest, pixel format and time stamp.

refsect2.title: arv_buffer_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new buffer for the storage of the video stream images. The data space can be either preallocated, and the caller is responsible for it's deallocation, or allocated by this function. If it is the case, data memory will be freed when the buffer is destroyed.

refsect2.title: arv_buffer_new_full ()
refsect2.programlisting: ArvBuffer * arv_buffer_new_full (size_t size, void *preallocated, void *user_data, GDestroyNotify user_data_destroy_func);
refsect2.para: Creates a new buffer for the storage of the video stream images. The data space can be either preallocated, and the caller is responsible for it's deallocation, or allocated by this function. If it is the case, data memory will be freed when the buffer is destroyed.
If user_data_destroy_func is non NULL, it will be called in order to destroy user_data when the buffer is destroyed.

entry.para: a pointer to user data associated to this buffer.
an optional user data destroy callback

refsect2.title: arv_buffer_new_allocate ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new buffer for the storage of the video stream images. The data space is allocated by this function, and will be freed when the buffer is destroyed.

refsect2.title: arv_buffer_get_user_data ()
refsect2.para: Gets a pointer to user data set by arv_buffer_new_full.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: user data, or NULL if not set.

entry.para: location to store data size, or NULL.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a pointer to the buffer data.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if buffer has a payload type that contains chunk data.

refsect2.title: arv_buffer_get_chunk_data ()
refsect2.programlisting: const void * arv_buffer_get_chunk_data (ArvBuffer *buffer, guint64 chunk_id, size_t *size);

entry.para: location to store chunk data size, or NULL.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a pointer to the chunk data.

refsect2.title: arv_buffer_get_timestamp ()
refsect2.para: Gets the buffer camera timestamp, expressed as nanoseconds. Not all devices provide reliable timestamp, which means sometimes its better to rely on the buffer completion host local time, or to use arv_buffer_get_system_timestamp().

refsect2.title: arv_buffer_set_timestamp ()
refsect2.para: Sets the buffer timestamp, which allows to override the timpestamp set by the camera, which in some case is incorrect.

refsect2.title: arv_buffer_get_system_timestamp ()
refsect2.para: Gets the system timestamp for when the frame was received. Expressed in nanoseconds.

refsect2.title: arv_buffer_set_system_timestamp ()
refsect2.para: Sets the system timestamp for when the frame was received. Expressed in nanoseconds.

refsect2.title: arv_buffer_set_frame_id ()
refsect2.para: Sets the buffer frame id. For GigEVision devices, 0 is an invalid value.

refsect2.title: arv_buffer_get_frame_id ()
refsect2.para: Gets the buffer frame id. For GigEVision devices, 0 is an invalid value.

refsect2.title: arv_buffer_get_image_height ()
refsect2.para: Gets the image width. This function must only be called on buffer containing a ARV_BUFFER_PAYLOAD_TYPE_IMAGE payload.

refsect2.title: arv_buffer_get_image_pixel_format ()
refsect2.para: Gets the image pixel format. This function must only be called on buffer containing a ARV_BUFFER_PAYLOAD_TYPE_IMAGE payload.

refsect2.title: arv_buffer_get_image_region ()
refsect2.programlisting: void arv_buffer_get_image_region (ArvBuffer *buffer, gint *x, gint *y, gint *width, gint *height);
refsect2.para: Gets the image region. This function must only be called on buffer containing a ARV_BUFFER_PAYLOAD_TYPE_IMAGE payload.

refsect2.title: arv_buffer_get_image_width ()
refsect2.para: Gets the image width. This function must only be called on buffer containing a ARV_BUFFER_PAYLOAD_TYPE_IMAGE payload.

refsect2.title: arv_buffer_get_image_x ()
refsect2.para: Gets the image x offset. This function must only be called on buffer containing a ARV_BUFFER_PAYLOAD_TYPE_IMAGE payload.

refsect2.title: arv_buffer_get_image_y ()
refsect2.para: Gets the image y offset. This function must only be called on buffer containing a ARV_BUFFER_PAYLOAD_TYPE_IMAGE payload.

entry.para: the buffer contains a valid image
timeout was reached before all packets are received
stream has packet with wrong id
the received image didn't fit in the buffer data space
the image is currently being filled
the filling was aborted before completion

refsect2.title: ArvPixelFormat
refsect2.para: A datatype to hold a pixel format.
